intro: Psychotria andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. The plant has been studied for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its therapeutic uses.
